articles.author: Stephen Nellis, Max Cherney
articles.description: In a new front in the U.S.-China tech war, President Joe Biden's administration is facing pressure from some lawmakers to restrict American companies from working on a freely available chip technology widely used in China - a move that could upend how the global technology industry collaborates across borders.
articles.title: Exclusive: US-China tech war: RISC-V chip technology emerges as new battleground

articles.author: Anna Tong, Max Cherney, Christopher Bing, Stephen Nellis
articles.description: OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT, is exploring making its own artificial intelligence chips and has gone as far as evaluating a potential acquisition target, according to people familiar with the company’s plans.
articles.title: Exclusive: ChatGPT-owner OpenAI is exploring making its own AI chips

articles.author: Jorgelina Rosario, Rachel Savage
articles.description: Emerging economies are facing headwinds from all sides, with a recent selloff in U.S. Treasuries and China's slowing economy adding layers of uncertainty while the Federal Reserve might not have reached the end of its rate hike cycle.
articles.title: Emerging economies face China and rate pressures as IMF, World Bank meet

articles.author: Jorge Otaola
articles.description: Corporate Argentina is strongly against full dollarization of the economy, one of the key proposals of presidential election frontrunner Javier Milei, according to 125 business people Reuters spoke to.
articles.title: Argentina Inc doesn't want dollarization, business leaders say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Elon Musk-led Tesla (TSLA.O) on Friday cut prices for its Model 3 and Model Y vehicles in the U.S., according to the electric vehicle maker's website.
articles.title: Tesla slashes prices of Model 3, Models Y vehicles in US

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: A new U.S. employment report on Friday will show whether the labor market continued to moderate through September in what could be an important waypoint for Federal Reserve officials deciding whether to push ahead with another interest rate increase this year or sit tight.
articles.title: U.S. jobs data could be the Fed's cue to hike or hold

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nestle (NESN.S) shares were under pressure on Friday as investors weighed the potential impact of Novo Nordisk's (NOVOb.CO) blockbuster weight-losing drug Wegovy and how it could reduce spending on food.
articles.title: Nestle shares at two-year low as investors weigh Wegovy rollout

articles.author: Sinead Cruise, Iain Withers
articles.description: Debt-laden companies across Europe, Middle East and Africa face a $500 billion refinancing scramble in the first half of 2024, a challenge that could kill off many "zombie" businesses even though an expected peak in rates could bring some relief.
articles.title: Fall of the zombies? Why corporate failures could surge in 2024

articles.author: Gabriela Baczynska, Inti Landauro
articles.description: Poland accused Berlin and Brussels of imposing a migration "diktat" on the European Union and Hungary said the bloc was forcing through a deal as EU leaders gathered to tackle the growing number of immigrants from the Middle East and Africa.
articles.title: Hungary, Poland rail at EU migration policy as bloc leaders meet

articles.author: Michael Martina, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Early in the Biden administration, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken vowed that the United States would only hold talks with China if they led to "tangible outcomes" to resolve disputes between the strategic rivals.
articles.title: Is the US strategy of engaging China working?
